ARTWORK: 3.Highest| believes that the creation and appreciation of artwork is one of the highest ideals
2.VeryHigh| greatly respects artists and their works
0.Neutral| doesn't care about art one way or another
-2.VeryLow| sees the whole pursuit of art as silly
-3.Lowest| finds art offensive and would have it destroyed whenever possible
COMMERCE: 3.Highest| sees engaging in commerce as a high ideal in life
2.VeryHigh| really respects commerce and those that engage in trade
-1.Low| is somewhat put off by trade and commerce
-2.VeryLow| finds those that engage in trade and commerce to be fairly disgusting
-3.Lowest| holds the view that commerce is a vile obscenity
COMPETITION: 3.Highest| holds the idea of competition among the most important values and would encourage it wherever possible
2.VeryHigh| views competition as a crucial driving force in the world
0.Neutral| doesn't have strong views on competition
-1.Low| sees competition as wasteful and silly
-3.Lowest| finds the very idea of competition obscene
COOPERATION: 3.Highest| places cooperation as one of the highest ideals
2.VeryHigh| sees cooperation as very important in life
-2.VeryLow| views cooperation as a low ideal not worthy of any respect
CRAFTSMANSHIP: 3.Highest| holds crafts[man]ship to be of the highest ideals and celebrates talented artisans and their masterworks
2.VeryHigh| has a great deal of respect for worthy crafts[man]ship
-1.Low| considers crafts[man]ship to be relatively worthless
-2.VeryLow| sees the pursuit of good crafts[man]ship as a total waste
-3.Lowest| views crafts[man]ship with disgust and would desecrate a so-called masterwork or two if [he/she] could get away with it
CUNNING: 3.Highest| holds well-laid plans and shrewd deceptions in the highest regard
2.VeryHigh| greatly respects the shrewd and guileful
0.Neutral| does not really value cunning and guile
-1.Low| sees guile and cunning as indirect and somewhat worthless
-2.VeryLow| holds shrewd and crafty individuals in the lowest esteem
-3.Lowest| is utterly disgusted by guile and cunning
DECORUM: 3.Highest| views decorum as a high ideal and is deeply offended by those that fail to maintain it
2.VeryHigh| greatly respects those that observe decorum and maintain their dignity
1.High| values decorum, dignity and proper behavior
0.Neutral| doesn't care very much about decorum
-1.Low| finds maintaining decorum a silly, fumbling waste of time
-2.VeryLow| sees those that attempt to maintain dignified and proper behavior as vain and offensive
-3.Lowest| is affronted by the whole notion of maintaining decorum and finds so-called dignified people disgusting
ELOQUENCE: 3.Highest| believes that artful speech and eloquent expression are some of the highest ideals
-1.Low| finds eloquence and artful speech off-putting
-2.VeryLow| finds [him/her]self somewhat disgusted with eloquent speakers
-3.Lowest| sees artful speech and eloquence as a wasteful form of deliberate deception and treats it as such
FAIRNESS: 3.Highest| holds fairness as one of the highest ideals and despises cheating of any kind
-1.Low| sees life as unfair and doesn't mind it that way
-2.VeryLow| finds the idea of fair-dealing foolish and cheats when [he/she] finds it profitable
-3.Lowest| is disgusted by the idea of fairness and will freely cheat anybody at any time
FAMILY: 3.Highest| sees family as one of the most important things in life
0.Neutral| does not care about family one way or the other
-3.Lowest| finds the idea of family loathsome
FRIENDSHIP: 3.Highest| believes friendship is a key to the ideal life
2.VeryHigh| sees friendship as one of the finer things in life
-2.VeryLow| is completely put off by the idea of friends
-3.Lowest| finds the whole idea of friendship disgusting
HARD_WORK: 3.Highest| believes that hard work is one of the highest ideals and a key to the good life
2.VeryHigh| deeply respects those that work hard at their labors
0.Neutral| doesn't really see the point of working hard
-1.Low| sees working hard as a foolish waste of time
-2.VeryLow| thinks working hard is an abject idiocy
-3.Lowest| finds the proposition that one should work hard in life utterly abhorrent
HARMONY: 3.Highest| would have the world operate in complete harmony without the least bit of strife or disorder
2.VeryHigh| strongly believes that a peaceful and ordered society without dissent is best
0.Neutral| sees equal parts of harmony and discord as part of life
-1.Low| doesn't respect a society that has settled into harmony without debate and strife
-2.VeryLow| can't fathom why anyone would want to live in an orderly and harmonious society
-3.Lowest| believes deeply that chaos and disorder are the truest expressions of life and would disrupt harmony wherever it is found
INDEPENDENCE: 3.Highest| believes that freedom and independence are completely non-negotiable and would fight to defend them
0.Neutral| doesn't really value independence one way or another
-1.Low| finds the ideas of independence and freedom somewhat foolish
-2.VeryLow| sees freedom and independence as completely worthless
-3.Lowest| hates freedom and would crush the independent spirit wherever it is found
INTROSPECTION: 3.Highest| feels that introspection and all forms of self-examination are the keys to a good life and worthy of respect
0.Neutral| doesn't really see the value in self-examination
-1.Low| finds introspection to be a waste of time
-2.VeryLow| thinks that introspection is valueless and those that waste time in self-examination are deluded fools
-3.Lowest| finds the whole idea of introspection completely offensive and contrary to the ideals of a life well-lived
KNOWLEDGE: 3.Highest| finds the quest for knowledge to be of the very highest value
2.VeryHigh| views the pursuit of knowledge as deeply important
0.Neutral| doesn't see the attainment of knowledge as important
-1.Low| finds the pursuit of knowledge to be a waste of effort
-2.VeryLow| thinks the quest for knowledge is a delusional fantasy
-3.Lowest| sees the attainment and preservation of knowledge as an offensive enterprise engaged in by arrogant fools
LAW: 3.Highest| is an absolute believer in the rule of law
2.VeryHigh| has a great deal of respect for the law
0.Neutral| doesn't feel strongly about the law
-3.Lowest| finds the idea of laws abhorrent
LEISURE_TIME: 3.Highest| believes that it would be a fine thing if all time were leisure time
2.VeryHigh| treasures leisure time and thinks it is very important in life
0.Neutral| doesn't think one way or the other about leisure time
-2.VeryLow| is offended by leisure time and leisurely living
-3.Lowest| believes that those that take leisure time are evil and finds the whole idea disgusting
LOYALTY: 3.Highest| has the highest regard for loyalty
-3.Lowest| is disgusted by the idea of loyalty
MARTIAL_PROWESS: 3.Highest| believes that martial prowess defines the good character of an individual
0.Neutral| does not really value skills related to fighting
-1.Low| finds those that develop skill with weapons and fighting distasteful
-2.VeryLow| thinks that the pursuit of the skills of warfare and fighting is a low pursuit indeed
-3.Lowest| abhors those that pursue the mastery of weapons and skill with fighting
MERRIMENT: 3.Highest| believes that little is better in life than a good party
1.High| finds merrymaking and partying worthwhile activities
-3.Lowest| is appalled by merrymaking, parties and other such worthless activities
NATURE: 3.Highest| holds nature to be of greater value than most aspects of civilization
2.VeryHigh| has a deep respect for animals, plants and the natural world
0.Neutral| doesn't care about nature one way or another
-2.VeryLow| has a deep dislike of the natural world
-3.Lowest| would just as soon have nature and the great outdoors burned to ashes and converted into a great mining pit
PEACE: 3.Highest| believes the idea of war is utterly repellent and would have peace at all costs
2.VeryHigh| believes that peace is always preferable to war
0.Neutral| doesn't particularly care between war and peace
-1.Low| sees war as a useful means to an end
-2.VeryLow| believes war is preferable to peace in general
-3.Lowest| thinks that the world should be engaged in perpetual warfare
PERSEVERANCE: 3.Highest| believes that perseverance is one of the greatest qualities somebody can have
2.VeryHigh| greatly respects individuals that persevere through their trials and labors
0.Neutral| doesn't think much about the idea of perseverance
-1.Low| sees perseverance in the face of adversity as bull-headed and foolish
-2.VeryLow| thinks there is something deeply wrong with people that persevere through adversity
-3.Lowest| finds the notion that one would persevere through adversity completely abhorrent
POWER: 3.Highest| believes that the acquisition of power over others is the ideal goal in life and worthy of the highest respect
2.VeryHigh| sees power over others as something to strive for
-1.Low| has a negative view of those who exercise power over others
-2.VeryLow| hates those who wield power over others
-3.Lowest| finds the acquisition and use of power abhorrent and would have all masters toppled
ROMANCE: 3.Highest| sees romance as one of the highest ideals
2.VeryHigh| thinks romance is very important in life
0.Neutral| doesn't care one way or the other about romance
-3.Lowest| finds even the abstract idea of romance repellent
SACRIFICE: 3.Highest| finds sacrifice to be one of the highest ideals
2.VeryHigh| believes that those who sacrifice for others should be deeply respected
0.Neutral| doesn't particularly respect sacrifice as a virtue
-1.Low| sees sacrifice as wasteful and foolish
-2.VeryLow| finds sacrifice to be the height of folly
-3.Lowest| thinks that the entire concept of sacrifice for others is truly disgusting
SELF_CONTROL: 3.Highest| believes that self-mastery and the denial of impulses are some of the highest ideals
2.VeryHigh| finds moderation and self-control to be very important
-1.Low| finds those that deny their impulses somewhat stiff
-2.VeryLow| sees the denial of impulses as a vain and foolish pursuit
-3.Lowest| has abandoned any attempt at self-control and finds the whole concept deeply offensive
SKILL: 3.Highest| believes that the mastery of a skill is one of the highest pursuits
2.VeryHigh| really respects those that take the time to master a skill
0.Neutral| doesn't care if others take the time to master skills
-1.Low| finds the pursuit of skill mastery off-putting
-2.VeryLow| believes that the time taken to master a skill is a horrible waste
-3.Lowest| sees the whole idea of taking time to master a skill as appalling
STOICISM: 3.Highest| views any show of emotion as offensive
2.VeryHigh| thinks it is of the utmost importance to present a bold face and never grouse, complain or even show emotion
1.High| believes it is important to conceal emotions and refrain from complaining
0.Neutral| doesn't see much value in being stoic
-1.Low| sees no value in holding back complaints and concealing emotions
-2.VeryLow| feels that those who attempt to conceal their emotions are vain and foolish
-3.Lowest| sees concealment of emotions as a betrayal and tries [his/her] best never to associate with such secretive fools
TRADITION: 3.Highest| holds the maintenance of tradition as one of the highest ideals
2.VeryHigh| is a firm believer in the value of tradition
0.Neutral| doesn't have any strong feelings about tradition
-2.VeryLow| finds the following of tradition foolish and limiting
-3.Lowest| is disgusted by tradition and would flout any [he/she] encounters if given a chance
TRANQUILITY: 3.Highest| views tranquility as one of the highest ideals
1.High| values tranquility and a peaceful day
0.Neutral| doesn't have a preference between tranquility and tumult
-1.Low| prefers a noisy, bustling life to boring days without activity
-2.VeryLow| is greatly disturbed by quiet and a peaceful existence
-3.Lowest| is disgusted by tranquility and would that the world would constantly churn with noise and activity
TRUTH: 3.Highest| believes the truth is inviolable regardless of the cost
2.VeryHigh| believes that honesty is a high ideal
0.Neutral| does not particularly value the truth
-2.VeryLow| sees lying as an important means to an end
-3.Lowest| is repelled by the idea of honesty and lies without compunction
